paper_title.ja: 主体的学習を生かす複式授業の環境設計(2): 少人数教育を生かした地域学習の計量的基盤

description.ja: 大学教育における、校外の事象を対象とした計量を主要な共通活動として用いる多様な授業を分析した。

publisher.ja: 北海道教育大学 学校地域教育研究支援センター僻地教育研究支援部門

paper_title.ja: 主体的学習を生かす複式授業の環境設計(1): 言葉への見直しを引き出す作図環境

description.ja: 大学教育における作図を主要な共通活動として用いる複式授業の経験を分析して初等中等教育の複式授業環境の設計につながる経験的枠組みの考察を試みた。共通の学習基盤を準備し異なる学習課題間の共通の検討基盤を与えるものは異なる課題の間に共通の問題構造と分析方法及び実践方法があることの発見である。発見の基盤が言葉のネットワークに組み込まれた表と図形であるとの着想に基づきそのような言葉と表と図形の関係が学生に発見を生む現象の観察と分析からそのような発見を容易化する作図環境について検討した。言語記述や数式記述に対応する内容を幾何学的な形として認知出来るように言葉や数値を配置した図形的要素を持った表として描くことが出来る環境が学生の理解増進に効果的であるという仮説が得られた。

publisher.ja: 北海道教育大学 学校・地域教育研究支援センター へき地教育研究支援部門

paper_title.ja: 主体的学習参加の基盤を準備する作図環境

description.ja: 物理学の導入授業を例として、微分方程式を差分近似で解く内容を、学習者にとって既習の計算方法を単純な作図で確認する場合について、図解技能を効果的に身につけるための作図環境を検討した。手書き作図を基本とした授業を、コンピュータを用いた授業との比較で検討した。

publisher.ja: PCカンファレンス北海道2013実行委員会

publication_name.ja: PCカンファレンス北海道論文集2013

paper_title.ja: 作図を中心とした物理で使う数学の統合力育成（２）コンピュータ処理に適した微分方程式の近似解法

description.ja:
授業冒頭で作図を中心とした復習テストを継続しながら、物理で使う数学の、コンピ
ュータ処理に適した近似解法を学習させている。微分方程式は通常の課程では微積分
を十分習得した学生に課されるが、コンピュータ処理を前提とした数値積分に相当す
る処理を、コンピュータを用いずに、幾何的手続きと四則演算を組み合わせて、手書
きの作図を行う事で、微積分の習得が不十分な学生に学習させる事ができる。初等的
な準備段階から高次の対称性に基づく近似法へと取り組みを進めた結果について分析
して、評価する。

paper_title.ja: 生体分子の分子動力学シミュレーション（２）応用
paper_title.en: Molecular Dynamics Simulation of Biological Molecules. (2). Practice.

description.ja: 分子動力学シミュレーションは、生体高分子の構造・物性・機能相関の研究に有用であることが一般に認められている。本総説では、筆者らが開発した生体分子解析用ソフトウェアPEACH（Program for Energetic Analysis of bioChemical molecules）を使って、タンパク質とDNAの分子動力学シミュレーションを行う場合の手続きを、実践的に解説する。
description.en: Molecular dynamics simulation has been extensively applied to analyses of structure, dynamics, and the function of biological molecules. In this review, the practical procedures of molecular dynamics simulations of a protein and DNA by using the software PEACH (Program for Energetic Analysis of bioCHemical molecules) are described.

paper_title.ja: Distribution Analysis of 5' Splice Site-Like Sequences in Human and Mouse pre-mRNAs

book_title.ja: Advances in Cognitive Neurodynamics (IV). Springer Netherlands, 2015. 385-389.Signal Processing by Ephaptic Coupling of Hodgkin-Huxley Axons.
book_title.en: Advances in Cognitive Neurodynamics (IV). Springer Netherlands, 2015. 385-389.Signal Processing by Ephaptic Coupling of Hodgkin-Huxley Axons.

description.ja: We examined a signal processing on Hodgkin-Huxley model repeats under ephaptic coupling resembling the early stage of axon bundles in auditory nerve. We show impulse conduction synchronizations in axons partially myelinated by an oligodendrocyte with propagation time difference has a potential to select functionally maturating axons. We discuss the possible feedback process for maintaining parallel-aligned axons corresponding to the signal flow.
description.en: We examined a signal processing on Hodgkin-Huxley model repeats under ephaptic coupling resembling the early stage of axon bundles in auditory nerve. We show impulse conduction synchronizations in axons partially myelinated by an oligodendrocyte with propagation time difference has a potential to select functionally maturating axons. We discuss the possible feedback process for maintaining parallel-aligned axons corresponding to the signal flow.

description.ja: Structural response time in a binding process from an metastable association state formed by an applied electric field induced dissociation was analyzed for the binding states of the porcine ribonuclease inhibitor and the bovine ribonuclease A. Motion of surface side chains of the ribonuclease inhibitor in the water was analyzed for a full atom model simulated by a molecular dynamics (MD) method at 300 K for the complex of the porcine ribonuclease inhibitor and the bovine ribonuclease A.

presentation_title.ja: Structure and dynamics of crystal-melt interface of H-bonded chain molecules: Diffuse melting in meso-2, 4-pentanediol

presenters_text.ja: N. Takahashi, W. Paul, R. Graf, and H. W. Spiess, G. Strobl, and Do Y. Yoon

event.ja: The Physical Society of Japan, 2016 Autumn Meeting

promoter.ja: The Physical Society of Japan

description.ja: We observed the disordered solid states and the orientationally ordered melt of the dimer molecules of polyvinyl alcohol, meso-2,4-pentanediol.

presentation_title.ja: Mesoscopic structural order in hydrogen bonding liquid

presenters_text.ja: Nobuyuki Takahashi, Wolfgang Paul and Do Y. Yoon

event.ja: The Physical Society of Japan, 2016 Autumn Meeting

promoter.ja: The Physical Society of Japan

description.ja: A persistent heterogeneous order is found in a liquid state of the meso-2,4-pentanediol for nanoscale fibers and for the bulk. A chain structure of hydrogen bonded oxygen is stable in the fiber and fluctuating in the bulk.

presentation_title.ja: Mesoscopic structural order in hydrogen bonding liquid
presentation_title.en: Mesoscopic structural order in hydrogen bonding liquid

presenters_text.ja: Nobuyuki Takahashi, Wolfgang Paul and Do Y. Yoon
presenters_text.en: Nobuyuki Takahashi, Wolfgang Paul and Do Y. Yoon

event.ja: 23rd Polymer Networks Group meeting

promoter.ja: Polymer Networks Group

location.ja: KTH Royal Institute of Technology, Sweden
location.en: KTH Royal Institute of Technology, Sweden

description.ja: A thermally persistent heterogeneous orientational order in a liquid state of the meso-2,4-pentanediol, a dimer of poly(vinyl alcohol) (PVA), was simulated by the molecular dynamics method in a temperature range between 240 K and 420 K for nanoscale fibers and for the bulk system. The calculated X-ray diffraction profile shows essentially the same structure in both the nanoscale fibers and the bulk, with the orientational order that is stable in the fiber and fluctuating in the bulk.
description.en: A thermally persistent heterogeneous orientational order in a liquid state of the meso-2,4-pentanediol, a dimer of poly(vinyl alcohol) (PVA), was simulated by the molecular dynamics method in a temperature range between 240 K and 420 K for nanoscale fibers and for the bulk system. The calculated X-ray diffraction profile shows essentially the same structure in both the nanoscale fibers and the bulk, with the orientational order that is stable in the fiber and fluctuating in the bulk.

presentation_title.ja: 主体的学習を生かす複式授業の環境設計(3): 計量基盤自己評価表による地域学習の学習目標明確化

event.ja: 第51回応用物理学会北海道支部学術講演会

promoter.ja: 応用物理学会北海道支部

description.ja: 学生による学習自己評価機能の改善を試みた。学習評価基準を以下のように設計し、学習活動の基盤となる知識、経験、技能の自己評価の測度として評価表を作成して自主的課題取り組み管理に利用した。評価表の利用の効果を事前テストと事後テストの定量比較と評価表の記入内容の区分判定との相関分析を中心として評価した。

presentation_title.ja: Localization of cochlear membrane spontaneous vibration

presenters_text.ja: Azusa Shiraishi, Hideaki Konno, Nobuyuki Takahashi

event.ja: 第51回応用物理学会北海道支部学術講演会

promoter.ja: 応用物理学会北海道支部

description.ja: Computer simulation showed localization of cochlear membrane spontaneous vibration in the characteristic high frequency region indicating the function of otoacoustic emission in the maturation process. Here, we analyze the Ca ion channel dependence of the localized spontaneous vibration of the cochlear membrane with the hair cells.

presentation_title.ja: Adative polarization switching in ferroelectric polymer nanostructures: Molecular dynamics simulation

event.ja: 日本化学会分子アーキテクトニクス研究会第６回研究会

promoter.ja: 日本化学会分子アーキテクトニクス研究会

location.ja: 京都大学桂キャンパス

description.ja: The waiting time dependent polarization switching time was examined for poly(vinylidene fluoride) by molecular dynamics simulations. Conformational relaxation as a molecular timer was suggested to account the adaptive polarization switching in the ferroelectric polymer.

presentation_title.ja: Spontaneous vibration of cochlear basilar membrane: A model of transient receptor potential coupled with the tip link vibration
presentation_title.en: Spontaneous vibration of cochlear basilar membrane: A model of transient receptor potential coupled with the tip link vibration

presenters_text.ja: Azusa Shiraishi, Hideaki Konno, Nobuyuki Takahashi
presenters_text.en: Azusa Shiraishi, Hideaki Konno, Nobuyuki Takahashi

event.ja: Physiology 2015

promoter.ja: The Physiological Society

description.ja: A mechanism of spontaneous generation of cochlear basilar membrane vibration by hair cells was examined under non-firing hair cell conditions simulated using a transient receptor potential (TRP) channel model equipped with the tandem repeats of outer hair cells driven by the membrane potential based on the Hodgkin-Huxley (HH) equations for their channels including TRP channel.
description.en: A mechanism of spontaneous generation of cochlear basilar membrane vibration by hair cells was examined under non-firing hair cell conditions simulated using a transient receptor potential (TRP) channel model equipped with the tandem repeats of outer hair cells driven by the membrane potential based on the Hodgkin-Huxley (HH) equations for their channels including TRP channel.

presenters_text.en: Nobuyuki Takahashi, Wolfgang Paul and Do Y. Yoon

event.en: 2015 Theory and Computer Simulation of Polymers: New Developments 4-th International Workshop

promoter.ja: Martin Luther University Halle Wittenberg Institute of Physics
promoter.en: Martin Luther University Halle Wittenberg Institute of Physics

description.ja: A thermally persistent orientation of the meso-2,4-pentanediol dimer of Polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) was simulated by the molecular dynamics method in a temperature range between 240 K and 420 K for nanoscale mesomorphic films and for the bulk system.
description.en: A thermally persistent orientation of the meso-2,4-pentanediol dimer of Polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) was simulated by the molecular dynamics method in a temperature range between 240 K and 420 K for nanoscale mesomorphic films and for the bulk system.

presentation_title.ja: Adaptive polarization switching in ferroelectric polymer:Molecular dynamics simulation
presentation_title.en: Adaptive polarization switching in ferroelectric polymer:Molecular dynamics simulation

event.ja: European Polymer Federation Congress 2015

promoter.ja: European Polymer Federation

description.ja: Polarization switching of poly(vinylidene fluoride) (PVDF) shows long-term stabilization of polarized direction after removal of switching electric field and repetitive switching with short time duration causes refreshing of the state. We found chain conformational defects act as a molecular timer to keep memory of duration of aging after the polarization switching in nanoscale crystalline film of PVDF sandwiched between solids imitating electrodes based on molecular dynamics simulations.
description.en: Polarization switching of poly(vinylidene fluoride) (PVDF) shows long-term stabilization of polarized direction after removal of switching electric field and repetitive switching with short time duration causes refreshing of the state. We found chain conformational defects act as a molecular timer to keep memory of duration of aging after the polarization switching in nanoscale crystalline film of PVDF sandwiched between solids imitating electrodes based on molecular dynamics simulations.

presentation_title.ja: Response time change mechanism of polarization switching in poly(vinylidene fluoride) : Molecular dynamics simulation
presentation_title.en: Response time change mechanism of polarization switching in poly(vinylidene fluoride) : Molecular dynamics simulation

event.ja: 64th SPSJ annual meeting

promoter.ja: Society of Polymer Science, Japan

description.ja: In order to account the effect of aging process after poling, we examined response time of chain conformational defects accompanied with dipole motions in nanoscale crystalline film of poly(vinylidene fluoride) (PVDF) sandwiched between solids imitating electrodes based on molecular dynamics simulations. Partially constrained chain showed dipole reorientation combined with change of conformation.
description.en: In order to account the effect of aging process after poling, we examined response time of chain conformational defects accompanied with dipole motions in nanoscale crystalline film of poly(vinylidene fluoride) (PVDF) sandwiched between solids imitating electrodes based on molecular dynamics simulations. Partially constrained chain showed dipole reorientation combined with change of conformation.

presentation_title.ja: Vibrational sensing in cochlea basilar membrane

presenters_text.ja: Azusa Shiraishi, Hideaki Konno, Nobuyuki Takahashi

event.ja: The 62nd JSAP Spring Meetng

promoter.ja: 公益社団法人 応用物理学会

location.ja: 東海大学 湘南キャンパス

description.ja: A sensing mechanism of cochlea basilar membrane vibration by hair cells was examined under non-firing conditions simulated with tandem repeats of hair cells oscillating the membrane potential based on the Hodgkin-Huxley equations for their channels including a transient receptor potential.

presentation_title.ja: Molecular Dynamics Simulation of Mesophase of a Conformational Mixture

event.ja: 50th Meeting JSAP Hokkaido

promoter.ja: 公益社団法人 応用物理学会北海道支部

location.ja: 旭川勤労者福祉会館, 旭川市

description.ja: Solidification of supercooled chains of meso-2,4-pentanediol was simulated by a molecular dynamics method at 240-320 K range and compared with the experiment based on the x-ray diffraction intensity distribution in the reciprocal space. Anisotropic order in the disordered solid state found in the experiment was similar to the simulated local order of the molecules bounded by a solid plate resembling metal.

presentation_title.ja: Polarization switching in ferroelectric polymer nanocrystal

event.ja: 第28回分子シミュレーション討論会

promoter.ja: 第28回分子シミュレーション討論会実行委員会事務局

description.ja: Polarization switching of poly(vinylidene fluoride) (PVDF) shows long-term stabilization of polarized direction after removal of switching electric field and repetitive switching with short time duration causes refreshing of the state. We examined reorganization of dipoles after removal of switching electric field in nanocrystal formed on basal solid based on molecular dynamics simulations of nanoscale crystalline film of PVDF sandwiched between solids imitating electrodes.

presentation_title.ja: Effect of electrodes as a device of extended environment on electrostatics
presentation_title.en: Effect of electrodes as a device of extended environment on electrostatics

event.ja: International Symposium on Extended Molecular Dynamics and Enhanced Sampling: Nose Dynamics 30 Years (NOSE30)
event.en: International Symposium on Extended Molecular Dynamics and Enhanced Sampling: Nose Dynamics 30 Years (NOSE30)

promoter.ja: NOSE30 organizing committee

description.ja: We examined equations describing dynamics of electrostatic charges on electrodes compensating the system charges, and applied the equations to molecular dynamics simulations of polarization fluctuation after polarization reversals in the ferroelectric polymer. The polarization fluctuations were analyzed. We discussed the effect of equations on the fluctuation comparing with the fluctuation of Nose-Hoover Dynamics.
description.en: We examined equations describing dynamics of electrostatic charges on electrodes compensating the system charges, and applied the equations to molecular dynamics simulations of polarization fluctuation after polarization reversals in the ferroelectric polymer. The polarization fluctuations were analyzed. We discussed the effect of equations on the fluctuation comparing with the fluctuation of Nose-Hoover Dynamics.

presentation_title.ja: Ephaptic coupling of parallel axons in myelin maturation process of auditory nerve

presenters_text.ja: N Takahashi, M Yamada, H Konno

event.ja: THE FEDERATION OF EUROPEAN NEUROSCIENCE SOCIETIES (FENS) Forum 2014

promoter.ja: THE FEDERATION OF EUROPEAN NEUROSCIENCE SOCIETIES

description.ja: We examined a special signal processing on Hodgkin-Huxley model repeats under ephaptic coupling corresponding to the early stage of auditory axon bundles. Action potentials synchronizations are analyzed computational for a ladder-like circuit consisting of tandem repeats of Hodgkin-Huxley active nodes. We show impulse conduction synchronization in a partial myelinated axon adjacent to the thinner axon with propagation time difference has a potential to select functionally maturating axons.
